item.description: <p>A television ad ﻿showing a &quot;zombie-proof&quot; electric car has topped the list of Australia&#x27;s least favourite promotions of 2025.</p>

item.title: Adelaide beaches get good bill of health just in time for summer holidays
item.description: <p>Adelaide&#x27;s beaches are showing significant signs of recovery from South Australia&#x27;s toxic algal bloom.</p>

item.title: 'The best police force in the world': Mal Lanyon returns to police academy to speak with new cops
item.description: <p>NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has visited the Goulburn police academy to address more than 300 new probationary constables before they&#x27;re sworn in.</p>

item.title: Man charged over alleged murder of Adelaide father
item.description: <p>D﻿etectives said more people could be involved and are continuing to investigate. </p>

item.title: Woman, 72, killed, son hospitalised in Adelaide house fire
item.description: <p>The family dog, who was originally thought missing, was later found hiding under an ambulance.﻿</p>

item.title: Watches worth nearly $8.5m still missing after French thieves target Canberra home
item.description: <p>O﻿ver 70 luxury items worth around $10 million were stolen, and some still haven&#x27;t been recovered.</p>

item.title: Unemployment remains steady at 4.3 per cent
item.description: <p>﻿Full-time employment fell by 57,000 people, with 40,000 males and 16,000 females exiting the workforce.</p>

item.title: 'Lifelong sentence' for masseur's sex assault victim
item.description: <p>The 32-year-old was looking forward to a treatment touted as &quot;magical&quot; on the Kyle and Jackie O show.</p>

item.title: Hundreds of artefacts stolen from Bristol Museum
item.description: <p>Hundreds of artefacts have been stolen from a major British museum in a heist just weeks before the high-profile theft at the Louvre in Paris.</p>

item.title: Warnings lowered to watch and act for two Perth bushfires
item.description: <p>Firefighters remained on the ground ﻿in both Kenwick, in the city&#x27;s east, and in Upper Swan, to keep on top of the blazes that were threatening homes yesterday afternoon.</p>
